meanings.definition: Not resulting from the activity of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the abiogenic rocks, which formed without any help from living things.
meanings.sent2: The abiogenic process of crystal formation occurs without any involvement from living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The abiogenic crystals seemed to have a party of their own, growing in a non-living dance.
meanings.sent4: The desert landscape was like an abiogenic painting, devoid of any living creature's touch.
meanings.sent5: The concept of abiogenic origin can be hard to grasp, but it simply means not created by living beings.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to substances that are not produced by living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The abiogenic minerals found in the cave were formed without any influence from living organisms.
meanings.sent2: In the laboratory, they studied abiogenic compounds that were not created by any living creature.
meanings.sent3: The abiogenic elements in the experiment seemed to have a mind of their own, separate from living things.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was an abiogenic masterpiece, inspired by nature but not created by any living being.
meanings.sent5: The abiogenic substances in the sample were clearly distinct from anything produced by living organisms.
